alert.note: Alert for Day; Grant; Marshall; Roberts (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued October 30 at 5:15PM MDT until October 30 at 5:45PM MDT by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: The National Weather Service in Aberdeen has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Southwestern Roberts County in northeastern South Dakota... Northeastern Day County in northeastern South Dakota... Southeastern Marshall County in northeastern South Dakota... Northwestern Grant County in northeastern South Dakota... * Until 645 PM CDT. * At 614 PM CDT, a dangerous snow squall was located over Waubay Wildlife Rec Area, or over Enemy Swim Housing, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and visibility rapidly falling to less than one-quarter mile. Wind gusts greater than 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. South Dakota Highway 12 may be affected. Locations impacted include... Waubay, Enemy Swim Housing, Summit, Roslyn, Ortley, Grenville, Finley Heights Housing, Waubay Lake, Minnewasta Lake, Rudebusch Corner, Blue Dog Lake, Waubay Wildlife Rec Area, Enemy Swim Lake, Rush Lake, Campbell Slough, Pickerel Lake Rec Area, Opitz Lake, Bitter Lake, and southern Lake Traverse Reservation. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead to accidents. SNOW SQUALL...RADAR INDICATED
